term.longtitle: IUPAC Gold Book - isotropic pitch-based carbon fibres
term.title: isotropic pitch-based carbon fibres

item.text: Carbon fibres obtained by carbonization of isotropicpitch fibres after these have been stabilized (i.e. made non-fusible).

notes.item: During fabrication of isotropic pitch-based carbon fibres no means (neither mechanical nor chemical) are applied to achieve preferred orientation of the polyaromatic molecules in the fibre direction. They belong to the carbon fibres type LM (low modulus), and because of the relatively low values of strength and Young's modulus this pitch-based carbon fibres type is not used for high-performance reinforcement purposes.

sources.item: PAC, 1995, 67, 473. 'Recommended terminology for the description of carbon as a solid (IUPAC Recommendations 1995)' on page 495 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac199567030473)
